<p>Elite Dangerous brings gaming’s original open world adventure to the modern generation with a stunning recreation of the entire Milky Way galaxy. Here battles rage, governments fall, and humanity’s frontier expands – and you can impact it all. Welcome to the definitive massively multiplayer space epic.</p></div> <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," alt="Elite Icon" data-v-6464fc70=""></div></div> <div data-fetch-key="data-v-168e6803:0" class="c-game-pillars" data-v-168e6803="" data-v-c3e71a2e=""><div class="c-game-pillars__phonetablet" data-v-168e6803=""><div data-v-168e6803="" class="c-game-pillars__pillars"><div data-v-168e6803="" aria-label="Slideshow" class="vueperslides no-shadow vueperslides--ready vueperslides--touchable vueperslides--fixed-height vueperslides--bullets-outside" style="height: 540px;"><!----><div class="vueperslides__inner"><div aria-live="polite" class="vueperslides__parallax-wrapper" style="padding-bottom: 33.3333%;"><div class="vueperslides__track"><div class="vueperslides__track-inner" style="transition-duration: 600ms; Customise the look of your Commander, outfit your ship with upgrades, freshen up your SRV’s paint job, and more.</p></div> <ul data-v-5556965b=""><li data-v-5556965b=""><a href="/equip/cmdr" data-v-5556965b="" class="">
              View all
            </a></li> <li data-v-5556965b=""><a href="https://dlc.elitedangerous.com" class="purchase" data-v-5556965b="">
              DLC Store
            </a></li></ul></div></div></div></div> <div slug="community-goals" data-fetch-key="data-v-31ab3315:0" class="c-community-goals" data-v-31ab3315="" data-v-c3e71a2e=""><div class="c-community-goals__container" data-v-31ab3315=""><div class="c-community-goals__content" data-v-31ab3315=""><figure data-v-31ab3315=""><img src="/_nuxt/img/community-icon.0e0837f.svg" alt="Community Goals Icon" data-v-31ab3315=""></figure> <div class="c-community-goals__content-intro" data-v-31ab3315=""><div data-v-31ab3315=""><h3>Community Goals</h3>

<p>Cooperate with Commanders en-masse to reshape the galaxy in Community Goals! Rally behind intergalactic causes to defend traders from ravaging pirates. Support and supply enterprising efforts to construct powerful Megaships and Starports. Earn exclusive decals, credits, and more!</p></div></div> <ul class="c-community-goals__content-goals" data-v-31ab3315=""><li data-v-31ab3315=""><a href="/community/goals" data-v-31ab3315="" class=""><h4 data-v-31ab3315="">Protect Deliveries to Muller Terminal</h4></a></li><li data-v-31ab3315=""><a href="/community/goals" data-v-31ab3315="" class=""><h4 data-v-31ab3315="">Upgraded Xeno Scanner Requires Resources</h4></a></li></ul></div></div> <div class="c-community-goals__media" data-v-31ab3315=""><figure data-v-31ab3315=""><img src="https://image-service.zaonce.net/eyJidWNrZXQiOiJmcm9udGllci1jbXMiLCJrZXkiOiIyMDIwLTEyL2NvbW11bml0eS1nb2Fsc18wLmpwZyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MzYwfX19 360w" alt="Community Goals" sizes="(max-width: 360px) 360px, (max-width: 640px) 640px, (max-width: 960px) 960px, 1280px" data-v-31ab3315="" srcset="https://image-service.zaonce.net/eyJidWNrZXQiOiJmcm9udGllci1jbXMiLCJrZXkiOiIyMDIwLTEyL2NvbW11bml0eS1nb2Fsc18wLmpwZyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MzYwfX19 360w, https://image-service.zaonce.net/eyJidWNrZXQiOiJmcm9udGllci1jbXMiLCJrZXkiOiIyMDIwLTEyL2NvbW11bml0eS1nb2Fsc18wLmpwZyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6NjQwfX19 640w, https://image-service.zaonce.net/eyJidWNrZXQiOiJmcm9udGllci1jbXMiLCJrZXkiOiIyMDIwLTEyL2NvbW11bml0eS1nb2Fsc18wLmpwZyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6OTYwfX19 960w, https://image-service.zaonce.net/eyJidWNrZXQiOiJmcm9udGllci1jbXMiLCJrZXkiOiIyMDIwLTEyL2NvbW11bml0eS1nb2Fsc18wLmpwZyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTI4MH19fQ== 1280w"></figure></div></div> <div class="v-home__news" data-v-c3e71a2e=""><div class="c-news-section-bar" data-v-5fc1c2c4="" data-v-c3e71a2e=""><div class="c-news-section-bar__container" data-v-5fc1c2c4=""><h5 data-v-5fc1c2c4="">Latest news</h5> <a href="/news" class="c-news-section-bar__link" data-v-5fc1c2c4="">

Federation ALERT* \r\nAegis aims to provide an update to the pulse wave xeno scanner that can locate captive humans on Thargoid Titans.\r\nDr Maximo Fonseca, the Alliance’s scientific liaison to Aegis, informed the media about the project:\r\n“Information provided by Seo Jin-ae suggests that people abducted by the Thargoids are being kept alive aboard the Titan motherships inside ‘pods’. This theory makes sense - since Thargoid atmospheres are toxic to humans, any captives are surely sealed in an environment that meets their respiratory and nutritional needs.”\r\n“The pulse wave xeno scanner has been modified by Allied, Federal and Imperial technicians, working in concert using Aegis’s communications protocols. The module’s electromagnetic pulse technology aims to identify these pods by detecting several key markers generated by living humans.”\r\n“A broader effort to prepare for humanitarian rescue efforts is underway, but we have encountered a shortage of neofabric insulation, polymers and thallium. Shipments of these materials are urgently required to support the crews onboard rescue megaships in its vital work.”\r\nContributors are asked to transport these commodities to Muller Terminal in the Rabh system. The CD-51 1447 Imperial Society has agreed to coordinate the enterprise on behalf of Aegis, and will protect deliveries by redeeming bounty vouchers for all wanted ships in the system.",format:a,processed:"\u003Cp\u003E*Pilots’ Federation ALERT*\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nAegis aims to provide an update to the pulse wave xeno scanner that can locate captive humans on Thargoid Titans.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nDr Maximo Fonseca, the Alliance’s scientific liaison to Aegis, informed the media about the project:\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“Information provided by Seo Jin-ae suggests that people abducted by the Thargoids are being kept alive aboard the Titan motherships inside ‘pods’. This theory makes sense - since Thargoid atmospheres are toxic to humans, any captives are surely sealed in an environment that meets their respiratory and nutritional needs.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“The pulse wave xeno scanner has been modified by Allied, Federal and Imperial technicians, working in concert using Aegis’s communications protocols. The module’s electromagnetic pulse technology aims to identify these pods by detecting several key markers generated by living humans.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“A broader effort to prepare for humanitarian rescue efforts is underway, but we have encountered a shortage of neofabric insulation, polymers and thallium. Shipments of these materials are urgently required to support the crews onboard rescue megaships in its vital work.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nContributors are asked to transport these commodities to Muller Terminal in the Rabh system. The CD-51 1447 Imperial Society has agreed to coordinate the enterprise on behalf of Aegis, and will protect deliveries by redeeming bounty vouchers for all wanted ships in the system.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n",summary:a},"field-galnet-date":dh,"field-galnet-guid":"64f8a1557c9ba66c940fea91","field-galnet-image":"CommunityNewsFeed_3","field-slug":"upgraded-xeno-scanner-requires-resources",id:"d8d39e82-9392-4cd1-a9c4-787bd394fa4c","node-type":a,"revision-uid":a,uid:a,links:B},{"drupal-internal--nid":4886,"drupal-internal--vid":30703,langcode:b,"revision-timestamp":al,"revision-log":a,status:c,title:"Rescue Megaships Scheduled to Redeploy",created:al,changed:al,promote:c,sticky:e,"default-langcode":c,"revision-translation-affected":c,path:{alias:a,pid:a,langcode:b},"publish-on":a,"unpublish-on":a,"content-translation-source":r,"content-translation-outdated":e,"published-at":al,body:{value:"*Pilots’ Federation ALERT*\r\nThe eleven megaships coordinating evacuation efforts from Thargoid-invaded systems are set to move over the next few weeks.\r\nMilitary analysis of the current front line has highlighted that the distance between active conflict areas and the megaships can be decreased with an acceptably low degree of risk. Vice Admiral Skylar Anderson, part of the Imperial delegation to Aegis, offered this comment:\r\n“Shortening the distance between systems which require humanitarian support and the megaships responsible for coordinating that support is important. Until now we have urged caution to maintain their current safe positions, since these vessels are obvious targets for Thargoid attack. But as our brave pilots continue to regain territory and push the alien forces back, we feel confident that this is the right decision.”\r\nFrom September 7th, the following megaships will temporarily cease offering new mission contracts. They will redeploy to new locations on September 14th, with missions offered once again:\r\nRescue Ship Foerster\r\nRescue Ship Hutner\r\nRescue Ship Seacole\r\nRescue Ship Yoshida\r\nAllied Solace\r\nFrom September 14th, the following megaships will temporarily cease offering new mission contracts. They will redeploy to new locations on September 21st, with missions offered once again:\r\nRescue Ship Bertschinger\r\nRescue Ship Cavell\r\nRescue Ship Cornwallis \r\nRescue Ship Kisseih\r\nImperial Sanctum\r\nFederal Haven\r\nAny ships or modules stored on the rescue megaships will be transported safely to the new location.",format:a,processed:"\u003Cp\u003E*Pilots’ Federation ALERT*\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nThe eleven megaships coordinating evacuation efforts from Thargoid-invaded systems are set to move over the next few weeks.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nMilitary analysis of the current front line has highlighted that the distance between active conflict areas and the megaships can be decreased with an acceptably low degree of risk. Wallglass, an independent firm that is much respected in the intelligence community, is seeking evidence to validate this accusation.\r\nHarlan Turk, Rackham’s running mate in the election, has lobbied for Congress to halt the investigation. He asserted: “The Federal Times is breaching the impartiality rules of journalism, and violating the security measures afforded to all presidential candidates.”  \r\nPolitical ICE-caster Sura Oyekan also voiced her objections: “This is an outrageous attack on the reputation of a respected public figure, a great man who has contributed so much to Federal commerce and culture.”\r\nThere was a more speculative approach from independent journalist Flint ‘Firemaker’ Lafosse:\r\n“Hiring the Wallglass Investigations Agency to dig up dirt on Zachary Rackham is a smart move, albeit an expensive one. They’ll already have insights from their own detectives Gunnarson and Wolfe, who infiltrated the Jokers’ Deck gambling circle and found Rackham was a member. Or was he really there to quietly fund the coup against Archon Delaine by two of his own arch-corsairs? I think we all know the answer.”\r\n“Wallglass might also have access to the finance systems of Rackham Capital Investments, which were originally acquired by a hacktivist group known as the Collective. These nameless geniuses stole a billion credits – the same amount suspiciously won by Rackham in the Federal Grand Lottery – and distributed it to former employees whose pensions had been illegally withheld. Bravo!”\r\n“The latest rumours are that Wallglass has tracked down fellow pirate Taja Gavaris, the ex-CFO who attempted a corporate takeover. Allegedly she fled Federal space after Rackham counter-blackmailed her, but if anyone knows where the bodies are buried, it’s Gavaris. File data shows that their conversation took place shortly before Professor Tesreau’s statement to the media on July 18th, in Alba Tesreau’s office at Aegis headquarters in Duamta.\r\nAfter a brief period of speculation, Seo Jin-ae herself confirmed that she released the logs. Seo indicated that rumours circulating on ‘alternative ICE channels’ of Aegis withholding information from the public were false, and that Tesreau intended to announce evidence of human abductions even before the Dedicant tragedy brought the news to prominence.\r\nErnesto Rios analysed the new information in an article for Vox Galactica:\r\n“Leaks of classified information are nothing new, but it is rare that they support rather than damage the target organisation. According to these recordings, the topic of millions of people missing from Thargoid-invaded systems was carefully considered prior to Aegis informing the public.”\r\n“A significant revelation relates to the visions experienced by Seo Jin-ae. She tells Tesreau and Tanner: ‘An image keeps repeating… Rows and rows of what I thought were eggs.’ But then clarifies: ‘They’re pods. Containers for humans.’ Seo claims that abducted people are being kept alive aboard the Titan motherships. The reason remains unknown, though Seo insists the abductees are ‘important to the next phase of the Thargoid invasion.’”\r\n“Tanner then queries that Aegis might develop a way to recover these pods. Aegis has confirmed reports that all Thargoids have now disappeared from that area of space. Aden Tanner delivered a summary:\r\n“Our pilots can no longer detect a single Thargoid ship anywhere in that region. In military terms, they have undertaken a full tactical withdrawal. It usually requires overwhelming firepower to drive out Thargoid forces, especially from multiple systems. In this case, there was no fleet action or anti-xeno operation sufficiently large to cause this response.”\r\nDr Jeong-Hui Shin of the Holloway Bioscience Institute observed:\r\n“This is atypical behaviour for the Thargoid species. Their territorial instincts are usually aggravated by the arrival of humans, as witnessed in several of the nebula colonies. It is unprecedented for them to avoid engaging us in battle. We can only theorise that their purpose for being in this region was interrupted, perhaps even invalidated, by our presence.”\r\nDev Venkatesh, a prominent xeno-peace advocate and former lecturer at Orion University, told Vox Galactica:\r\n“Frankly, this is a disappointing development. Here was a chance to observe this intelligent race in a non-combat environment, but it’s clear that our ships disrupted the Thargoids’ plans. I find it encouraging, however, that they chose to simply retreat instead of fight. We must hope that a similar opportunity will one day present itself, and perhaps we can approach it with greater caution.”",format:a,processed:"\u003Cp\u003EThe Thargoids have unexpectedly abandoned the region around Wregoe BU-Y b2-0, mere days after being discovered.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nThey were believed to be present due to an ancient site on the planet Wregoe BU-Y b2-0 1 c, which hosted a conflict between Guardian and Thargoid forces millions of years ago. Their territorial instincts are usually aggravated by the arrival of humans, as witnessed in several of the nebula colonies. It is unprecedented for them to avoid engaging us in battle. The number of systems controlled by the Titans’ invasion fleets has tumbled, allowing many millions of people to return to their homes. This is largely thanks to coordinated action by independent pilots and anti-xeno squadrons.” \r\n“However, I take no pleasure in reporting that the ‘unsubstantiated rumours’ I discussed last month are true. The Thargoids’ increased interest in capturing escape pods has been verified, with the appearance of a new vessel designed for this very task. Scythe-class hunters are now launching attacks en masse, using a combination of unique hull-breaching munitions and recovery drones to abduct living people.”\r\n“It’s believed that the Scythes were responsible for the disappearance of thousands aboard the Dedicant. There’s a horrific irony that most of these abductees were members of the Order of the Far God, finally getting their wish to be saved by their ‘angels’. From the logs found aboard the megaship, adrift in the HIP 19600 system, there was nothing holy about the experience.”\r\n“It’s fair to say that these latest revelations are further proof of the fluid nature of the war. They prove that the Thargoids are still adapting their tactics to the current challenge humans provide. What purposes they may have for human specimens remains unknown. But the psychological impact of that mystery – not knowing what they’re doing with the people they capture – will weaken the morale of many anti-xeno fighters.”\r\n“Another discovery this month was a planetary site in the Wregoe BU-Y b2-0 system. This contained both Guardian ruins and crashed Thargoid vessels, and is only the second of its kind ever recorded. More intriguingly, Thargoids active in the region are not attacking human ships on sight.”\r\n“Several pilots told me that this is still normal Thargoid behaviour near some of our populated nebula colonies. But xeno-peace activists feel that this discovery presents an opportunity. The Holloway Bioscience Institute is already planning an independent research expedition to the area. We’ll be watching what happens there very closely.”\r\n“This is Jade Sanderlyn for Vox Galactica. Now more than ever, stay safe out there.”\r\n",format:a,processed:"\u003Cp\u003EVox Galactica’s Jade Sanderlyn reviews developments in the ongoing war against the Thargoids.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“There have been some impressive territorial gains against the Thargoids in recent weeks. The number of systems controlled by the Titans’ invasion fleets has tumbled, allowing many millions of people to return to their homes. This is largely thanks to coordinated action by independent pilots and anti-xeno squadrons.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“However, I take no pleasure in reporting that the ‘unsubstantiated rumours’ I discussed last month are true. The Thargoids’ increased interest in capturing escape pods has been verified, with the appearance of a new vessel designed for this very task. Scythe-class hunters are now launching attacks en masse, using a combination of unique hull-breaching munitions and recovery drones to abduct living people.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“It’s believed that the Scythes were responsible for the disappearance of thousands aboard the Dedicant. There’s a horrific irony that most of these abductees were members of the Order of the Far God, finally getting their wish to be saved by their ‘angels’. From the logs found aboard the megaship, adrift in the HIP 19600 system, there was nothing holy about the experience.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“It’s fair to say that these latest revelations are further proof of the fluid nature of the war. They prove that the Thargoids are still adapting their tactics to the current challenge humans provide. What purposes they may have for human specimens remains unknown. But the psychological impact of that mystery – not knowing what they’re doing with the people they capture – will weaken the morale of many anti-xeno fighters.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“Another discovery this month was a planetary site in the Wregoe BU-Y b2-0 system. This contained both Guardian ruins and crashed Thargoid vessels, and is only the second of its kind ever recorded. More intriguingly, Thargoids active in the region are not attacking human ships on sight.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“Several pilots told me that this is still normal Thargoid behaviour near some of our populated nebula colonies. But xeno-peace activists feel that this discovery presents an opportunity. The Holloway Bioscience Institute is already planning an independent research expedition to the area. We’ll be watching what happens there very closely.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“This is Jade Sanderlyn for Vox Galactica. She recently announced that she was renewing efforts to prove his criminality, thereby invalidating him from holding the presidency under Federal electoral laws.\r\nIn an exclusive interview with Sol Today, Mr Rackham addressed the situation:\r\n“I’ve always been highly amused by these stories, which make out that I was some kind of swashbuckling corsair in my youth. No doubt they’ve helped boost sales of The Federal Times.”\r\n“But in the Federation, we have laws to protect innocent people – just like me! – from libellous accusations. It’s time for Ms Blanco to discard her poisonous obsession with me, or I’ll be forced to defend my good name through legal means. Hey, if she needs a good source of income, my campaign could always find use for an imaginative speech writer!”\r\nIn response, The Federal Times published a personal article by Bryanna Blanco:\r\n“Rackham does have one genuine talent: covering his tracks. With all his money and resources, he’s erased all evidence of his past. I’ve interviewed plenty of victims and witnesses, but most of my discoveries won’t stand up in court against his powerful legal team.”\r\n“So, with special funding provided by my editor, I’ve turned to the professionals. The Wallglass Investigations Agency has been hired to prove that Rackham operated as a pirate lord. If they can’t find irrefutable proof, nobody can. And if I’m proved wrong, then Calico Zack can take his shot at stealing the entire Federation.”",format:a,processed:"\u003Cp\u003EPresidential candidate Zachary Rackham has denied allegations that he was a notorious pirate lord prior to becoming an entrepreneur.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nFinancial journalist Bryanna Blanco has long maintained that the business magnate gained his initial fortune by means of piracy. She recently announced that she was renewing efforts to prove his criminality, thereby invalidating him from holding the presidency under Federal electoral laws.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nIn an exclusive interview with Sol Today, Mr Rackham addressed the situation:\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“I’ve always been highly amused by these stories, which make out that I was some kind of swashbuckling corsair in my youth. No doubt they’ve helped boost sales of The Federal Times.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“But in the Federation, we have laws to protect innocent people – just like me! – from libellous accusations. It’s time for Ms Blanco to discard her poisonous obsession with me, or I’ll be forced to defend my good name through legal means. Hey, if she needs a good source of income, my campaign could always find use for an imaginative speech writer!”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nIn response, The Federal Times published a personal article by Bryanna Blanco:\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“Rackham does have one genuine talent: covering his tracks. With all his money and resources, he’s erased all evidence of his past. I’ve interviewed plenty of victims and witnesses, but most of my discoveries won’t stand up in court against his powerful legal team.”\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n“So, with special funding provided by my editor, I’ve turned to the professionals. The Wallglass Investigations Agency has been hired to prove that Rackham operated as a pirate lord. If they can’t find irrefutable proof, nobody can. And if I’m proved wrong, then Calico Zack can take his shot at stealing the entire Federation.”\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n",summary:a},"field-galnet-date":"28 AUG 3309","field-galnet-guid":"64e7659192d1b2f4b8014152","field-galnet-image":"NewsImageFederalCityscape","field-slug":"rackham-refutes-rumours",id:"19de814e-2461-4d26-8c3b-2c3f3b184d59","node-type":a,"revision-uid":a,uid:a,links:B},{"drupal-internal--nid":4824,"drupal-internal--vid":30354,langcode:b,"revision-timestamp":ar,"revision-log":a,status:c,title:"Deliveries Requested to Commemorate Duval Family",created:ar,changed:ar,promote:c,sticky:e,"default-langcode":c,"revision-translation-affected":c,path:{alias:a,pid:a,langcode:b},"publish-on":a,"unpublish-on":a,"content-translation-source":r,"content-translation-outdated":e,"published-at":ar,body:{value:"*Pilots’ Federation ALERT*\r\nShipments of precious materials are needed in the Laedla system to build statues honouring the House of Duval.\r\nArchduke Otto Lombardo-Duval made a public announcement to launch the initiative:\r\n“We are all relieved that our beloved Imperial Mother is on the path to recovery. In such times, we must remember how much all citizens owe to the Duval dynasty, whose thousand-year reign has brought peace and prosperity to trillions.”\r\n“In honour of Her Majesty the Emperor and all those who came before her, I am arranging for mighty statues to adorn the public plazas of many Imperial worlds. Using the finest quality gold, jadeite and platinum, we will construct impressive monuments to the architects of our glorious Empire.”\r\nThe Imperial Herald published a related piece by royal correspondent Gudrun Vestergaard:\r\n“Archduke Otto Lombardo-Duval is the son of Prince Baylor Duval, one of Emperor Hesketh’s brothers, who married into the House of Lombardo nearly a century ago. This offshoot branch of the Imperial Family are survivors of the mass assassinations perpetrated by the NMLA, as a result of which their prominence among the nobility has risen.”\r\n“Emperor Arissa has given the statues her personal blessing, but the mood within the palace is mixed. Some view Archduke Otto as having delusions of grandeur. Others consider him an opportunist looking to ingratiate himself with more prominent family members. But perhaps this is a simple gesture in good faith – a swift response to Florence Lavigny’s request for unity within the royal family.”\r\nThe required resources can be delivered to Kummer Acropolis in the Laedla system. In some backwaters, tales are still told of how he personally led countless raids against cargo ships and passenger liners. Allegedly there were very few casualties in his wake, since the pirate always focused on hijacking valuables rather than causing bloodshed.”\r\n“As Calico Zack’s wealth and influence grew, Archon Delaine viewed him as a threat and planned to go to war. This may be what prompted him abandon piracy. He laundered his ill-gotten gains via shell corporations and stock investments, reinventing himself as Federal entrepreneur Zachary Rackham.” \r\n“Since those days – which he now claims were spent as a struggling trader – Rackham has become a trillionaire. He has absorbed companies, funded grandiose structures, and plastered his name wherever he could. Rackham Capital Investments is largely run by former pirate comrades turned businessmen, which has led to a few violent ‘resignations’ over the years.”\r\n“Rackham’s presidential candidacy has inspired me to redouble my efforts to expose his criminal past. I cannot imagine what the Federation will become if he is elected to high office.”\r\nThe Federal Times has come under fire from Zachary Rackham’s supporters, claiming it is acting on the orders of his political rivals. An editorial in rival newsfeed Sol Today said: \r\n“Bryanna Blanco was once a highly respected reporter, but should be facing libel charges for this kind of mudslinging. Conflict between the two species occurred millions of years ago, but physical evidence of this is extremely rare. The only comparable site, in the Trapezium Sector YU-X c1-2 system, was initially found two centuries ago by the Azimuth Biochemicals ship Proteus and rediscovered in 3307.\r\nWregoe BU-Y b2-0 was one of several systems under investigation following a report by Commander Renia Rakowski, who encountered a Thargoid interceptor in nearby Wregoe GA-X B3-0.\r\nThe Holloway Bioscience Institute has sent teams into the area to explore the possibility of xenoarchaeological research. Dr Jeong-Hui Shin gave a statement to The Sovereign newsfeed:\r\n“It is fascinating that none of the Thargoid vessels operating in this region are immediately aggressive. One of our theories is that they are still following million-year-old orders to attack the Guardians. Therefore, from their perspective, humans are an unknown species and not identified as an enemy. Alternatively, they may be pursuing non-combat functions such as meta-alloy harvesting, as with the Thargoids that can still be found in some nebulas.”\r\nProminent xeno-peace advocates including Timothy Culver, Bernadette Wells and Dev Venkatesh  have called for further study of the area. They claim that this is “an opportunity for non-hostile interactions with the Thargoids,” who may have developed “an autonomous subculture that is more amenable to coexistence with humanity, providing certain boundaries are respected.”\r\nOther pro-peace groups have demanded that naval forces should not be sent into the region, as the Thargoids may view this as a provocation. Modes",created:"2022-11-21T12:53:58+00:00",changed:"2022-11-30T17:36:45+00:00","publish-on":a,"unpublish-on":a,"published-at":"2022-11-23T15:13:13+00:00",body:{value:"\u003Cp\u003EGreetings Commanders.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn our Access to 4.0 post from August, we mentioned that future content would only be available to players on the 4.0 framework and from September we have offered access to version 4.0 to all PC users without requiring a purchase of Odyssey.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EOn 29 November, Update 14 will bring fundamental and exciting changes to the galaxy, built upon the 4.0 framework. Additionally, from Update 14 onwards, there will be two different modes to Elite Dangerous: Live mode and Legacy Mode.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003ELive Mode&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAs of Update 14, version 4.0 will become the “Live” mode in which all new content and events will be introduced. Focusing development on a single version branch has already been essential to delivering content of the same calibre as the Azimuth Saga finale. &nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAftermath will see its next major release with galaxy-wide implications in Update 14, with more to come in Updates 15 and 16. What we can say for now about Updates 15 and 16 is that they will both contain new content and gameplay mechanics linked to the unfolding events in the galaxy. More on this will be revealed next year. &nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003ELegacy Mode&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWhile “Live” will continue the unfolding events of Aftermath, we understand that some of our players have fond memories of the galaxy as it stands in 3.8 and as such we will convert version 3.8 into “Legacy Mode”.&nbsp;\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n&nbsp;\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nEvery player will have a Legacy Commander profile created from their existing profile with separately tracked progress when Update 14 is released. Legacy mode will be accessible from the launcher as a separate download from the Live game.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n&nbsp;\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nWhilst there will be no new narrative content such as GalNet or Community Goals, you will still be able to affect the galaxy via the background simulation. Actions in Legacy Mode will not affect the Live game.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n&nbsp;\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nAll cosmetics purchased prior to Update 14 will be available across both Legacy and Live versions. Moving forwards, some cosmetics may be exclusive to Live mode. These will be clearly marked as such in the store.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EPlaying Together on LIVE\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe understand that since we granted 4.0 access to all PC players, some Commanders have been using version 3.8 to play with friends who do not yet own Odyssey. With Update 14, Odyssey players will have the option to select either Horizons or Odyssey mode within Live Mode so that playing together remains possible.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EConsole Profile Copying Process&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EVia our website, console players have the option to clone their Commander profiles for use on PC without needing to re-purchase the game. The introduction of Legacy Mode is going to affect what data can be copied. For this reason, the process will be temporarily suspended with the release of Update 14. To ensure that everyone has the opportunity to use the process, it will be reintroduced in Q1 next year. &nbsp; &nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe version of the process that we reintroduce will not be as comprehensive as before and will only copy the most essential profile data related to player progression. For this reason, we strongly encourage anyone considering copying their profile to do so before Update 14.&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe hope this announcement has clearly explained our plans for both the Live and Legacy versions of Elite Dangerous.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe are excited not just for content in Update 14 but also for what we have planned in 2023.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAs always, we’d love to hear your questions, comments and feedback. &nbsp;\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n&nbsp;\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\no7&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n",format:F,processed:"\u003Cp\u003EGreetings Commanders.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EIn our Access to 4.0 post from August, we mentioned that future content would only be available to players on the 4.0 framework and from September we have offered access to version 4.0 to all PC users without requiring a purchase of Odyssey.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EOn 29 November, Update 14 will bring fundamental and exciting changes to the galaxy, built upon the 4.0 framework. Additionally, from Update 14 onwards, there will be two different modes to Elite Dangerous: Live mode and Legacy Mode.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\u003Ch3\u003ELive Mode \u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EAs of Update 14, version 4.0 will become the “Live” mode in which all new content and events will be introduced. Focusing development on a single version branch has already been essential to delivering content of the same calibre as the Azimuth Saga finale.  \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EAftermath will see its next major release with galaxy-wide implications in Update 14, with more to come in Updates 15 and 16. What we can say for now about Updates 15 and 16 is that they will both contain new content and gameplay mechanics linked to the unfolding events in the galaxy. More on this will be revealed next year.  \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\u003Ch3\u003ELegacy Mode \u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EWhile “Live” will continue the unfolding events of Aftermath, we understand that some of our players have fond memories of the galaxy as it stands in 3.8 and as such we will convert version 3.8 into “Legacy Mode”. \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nEvery player will have a Legacy Commander profile created from their existing profile with separately tracked progress when Update 14 is released. Legacy mode will be accessible from the launcher as a separate download from the Live game.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nWhilst there will be no new narrative content such as GalNet or Community Goals, you will still be able to affect the galaxy via the background simulation. Actions in Legacy Mode will not affect the Live game.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nAll cosmetics purchased prior to Update 14 will be available across both Legacy and Live versions. Moving forwards, some cosmetics may be exclusive to Live mode. These will be clearly marked as such in the store.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\u003Ch3\u003EPlaying Together on LIVE\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EWe understand that since we granted 4.0 access to all PC players, some Commanders have been using version 3.8 to play with friends who do not yet own Odyssey. With Update 14, Odyssey players will have the option to select either Horizons or Odyssey mode within Live Mode so that playing together remains possible.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\u003Ch3\u003EConsole Profile Copying Process \u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EVia our website, console players have the option to clone their Commander profiles for use on PC without needing to re-purchase the game. The introduction of Legacy Mode is going to affect what data can be copied. For this reason, the process will be temporarily suspended with the release of Update 14. To ensure that everyone has the opportunity to use the process, it will be reintroduced in Q1 next year.    \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EThe version of the process that we reintroduce will not be as comprehensive as before and will only copy the most essential profile data related to player progression. For this reason, we strongly encourage anyone considering copying their profile to do so before Update 14. \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Chr \u002F\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWe hope this announcement has clearly explained our plans for both the Live and Legacy versions of Elite Dangerous.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EWe are excited not just for content in Update 14 but also for what we have planned in 2023.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EAs always, we’d love to hear your questions, comments and feedback.  \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\no7 \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003E \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr 13, Narrative and Access to 4.0.",created:"2022-08-03T09:41:46+00:00",changed:"2022-08-03T12:59:50+00:00","publish-on":a,"unpublish-on":a,"published-at":"2022-08-03T11:00:00+00:00",body:{value:"\u003Cp\u003EGreetings Commanders, &nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe’re happy to confirm Update 13 is coming on \u003Cstrong\u003ETuesday 9 August\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E and will see the highly anticipated conclusion of the Azimuth Saga. It will also mark the beginning of the next major chapter in the Elite Dangerous narrative. We hope you’ll join us in HIP 22460 where we’ll be watching everything unfold! We’d like to take this moment to discuss what interacting with the story will look like following this conclusion. &nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHorizons and Odyssey currently exist as separate versions of the game: 3.8 and 4.0. The latter contains the foundational code which supports Odyssey content and a multitude of improvements added since Odyssey’s launch while the former does not. In our \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fforums.frontier.co.uk\u002Fthreads\u002Fconsole-update.600233\u002F\"\u003EConsole Update announcement in March\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, we mentioned aligning game development by releasing future content on the post-Odyssey codebase (version 4.0). This is essential to modernising the way we deliver content and ensuring various elements such as the interactive storyline continue expanding in scope and quality. &nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003ETo allow as many players as possible to experience the new narrative and gameplay elements, we intend to give all PC players access to version 4.0, at no additional cost, while keeping the upgrade to Odyssey optional. You will still be able to launch Elite in version 3.8 if you choose. This option is expected to come in the weeks following Update 13 with more details to be shared closer to the time. To understand what will be available to Horizons players on 4.0 compared to Odyssey players, see the table below. &nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cdrupal-media data-align=\"center\" data-entity-type=\"media\" data-entity-uuid=\"c0141e90-9ceb-4497-9971-52380f08e825\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fdrupal-media\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWith regards to how this affects the conclusion of the Azimuth Saga: delivering on our promise to offer the best possible narrative content requires taking full advantage of version 4.0.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003ETherefore, Horizons players will be able to witness the final event in the Azimuth Saga and access related gameplay scenarios. Moving forwards, all PC players will have access to content in the next narrative phase given they are using version 4.0, except in cases where on-foot gameplay (and by extension, Odyssey) is required. &nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThank you as always for your continued support and please leave any feedback or queries which we will address!&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;o7\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n",format:F,processed:"\u003Cp\u003EGreetings Commanders,  \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EWe’re happy to confirm Update 13 is coming on \u003Cstrong\u003ETuesday 9 August\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E and will see the highly anticipated conclusion of the Azimuth Saga. It will also mark the beginning of the next major chapter in the Elite Dangerous narrative. We hope you’ll join us in HIP 22460 where we’ll be watching everything unfold! We’d like to take this moment to discuss what interacting with the story will look like following this conclusion.  \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EHorizons and Odyssey currently exist as separate versions of the game: 3.8 and 4.0. The latter contains the foundational code which supports Odyssey content and a multitude of improvements added since Odyssey’s launch while the former does not. In our \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fforums.frontier.co.uk\u002Fthreads\u002Fconsole-update.600233\u002F\"\u003EConsole Update announcement in March\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, we mentioned aligning game development by releasing future content on the post-Odyssey codebase (version 4.0). This is essential to modernising the way we deliver content and ensuring various elements such as the interactive storyline continue expanding in scope and quality.  \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003ETo allow as many players as possible to experience the new narrative and gameplay elements, we intend to give all PC players access to version 4.0, at no additional cost, while keeping the upgrade to Odyssey optional. You will still be able to launch Elite in version 3.8 if you choose. This option is expected to come in the weeks following Update 13 with more details to be shared closer to the time. To understand what will be available to Horizons players on 4.0 compared to Odyssey players, see the table below.  \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcms-cdn.zaonce.net\u002Fstyles\u002Fmax_840w\u002Fs3\u002F2022-08\u002Felite_u13table_final.png?itok=QZHuPGpY\" width=\"840\" height=\"473\" alt=\"elite_u13table_final\" loading=\"lazy\" typeof=\"foaf:Image\" class=\"image-style-max-840w\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWith regards to how this affects the conclusion of the Azimuth Saga: delivering on our promise to offer the best possible narrative content requires taking full advantage of version 4.0.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003ETherefore, Horizons players will be able to witness the final event in the Azimuth Saga and access related gameplay scenarios. Moving forwards, all PC players will have access to content in the next narrative phase given they are using version 4.0, except in cases where on-foot gameplay (and by extension, Odyssey) is required.  \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EThank you as always for your continued support and please leave any feedback or queries which we will address! \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003E o7\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n",summary:g},"field-category":ab,"field-feature-in-game":e,"field-featured-bool":c,"field-hide-from-website-listings":e,"field-link":{uri:"https:\u002F\u002Fforums.frontier.co.uk\u002Fthreads\u002Fupdate-13-narrative-and-access-to-4-0.606333\u002F",title:ah,options:[]},"field-link-type":ai,"field-slug":"update-13-narrative-and-access-40",id:"d31ecc38-5925-4b96-918b-bd1e554facdd","field-game":[a,a],"field-site":[{langcode:b,name:i,description:a,weight:f,changed:k,"field-influencer-news":c,"field-slug":j,id:l}],"field-image-entity":{langcode:b,name:cQ,created:ck,changed:ck,id:"a3725c92-04af-4e4f-ba71-26d3ceb97247","field-game":[],thumbnail:{langcode:b,filename:cQ,uri:{value:jt,url:ju},filemime:K,filesize:jv,created:ck,changed:jw,id:jx},"field-media-image":{langcode:b,filename:cQ,uri:{value:jt,url:ju},filemime:K,filesize:jv,created:ck,changed:jw,id:jx}},links:H},{langcode:b,title:"Console Profile Transfers: FAQ and Expected Date",created:"2022-06-01T12:05:15+00:00",changed:"2022-06-01T12:15:05+00:00","publish-on":a,"unpublish-on":a,"published-at":"2022-06-01T12:00:00+00:00",body:{value:"\u003Cp\u003EGreetings Commanders,\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nMany of you will be aware that we announced an upcoming process which will allow players to copy progress from their console Commander profiles to PC. If you missed that announcement, you can&nbsp;\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fforums.frontier.co.uk\u002Fthreads\u002Fconsole-profile-transfers-and-2022-updates.603032\u002F\"\u003Efind more details here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Please note:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EThe original console profile will remain playable\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EOnly one profile may be copied per copy of Elite Dangerous\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EThis will be a one-time only process\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe're happy to confirm that this process is scheduled for release in September. The implementation has a lot of moving parts and we appreciate your patience and understanding.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nPlease find below an FAQ based on your queries to the previous announcement:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EConsole Profile Transfer FAQ\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhich elements of my console profile will be copied to PC?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EYour Commander name IF that name is not already in use on another PC account. If it is already taken, you will be given the chance to choose a new name as part of the process.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EShips (and all engineered modules on them), Holo-Me, weapons, SRVs and SLFs\r\n\t\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EIncluding Cobra Mk IV if owned\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\t\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ECredits\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EAll modules in storage; including all engineered, Community Goal, and Powerplay modules\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ECore progression (this includes…)\r\n\t\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EInventory\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EReputation\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003ENavy Ranks\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EPermits\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EThe Codex, with all discoveries and information gathered\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EEngineering progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003ETech Broker progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EPowerplay. You will remain pledged to the same power, at the same level with the same access to Powerplay rewards\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\t\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ENPC Crew names, appearance, and progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EIn-game customisations, such as Paint Jobs; Bobbleheads; Ship Kits and all other items purchasable with ARX\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EAny applied Livery\u002Fcustomisations will remain applied, so your PC CMDR and their ships will appear exactly as they were on Console before the copy\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhich elements of my console profile will NOT be copied to PC?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EYour Commander name if it is already in use by another PC player. You will be given the chance to choose a new name as part of the process\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EARX Balance. Please ensure that you purchase desired customisations before you complete the transfer. Any unspent Arx will remain on your original console profile\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ESquadron membership\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EFriends lists, Block lists and Private Groups\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ECurrent mission progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EFleet Carriers and their contents. Please see the fleet carrier section below for further advice\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhat are my options for my Fleet carrier and its contents?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nWe are looking at a number of options to give the best continuity for CMDRs being copied from Console to PC.  As soon as we have more information on Fleet Carriers, this page will be updated to reflect our plans.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EHow long will the copying process take to complete and will my console account be playable whilst this happens?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nThe process itself should be fast for each individual transfer. It may take longer during times of high demand if your request is part of a queue. If this happens, you will receive advice at the time and be given an expected wait time.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nOnce the request has been made, both accounts will be frozen and neither will be available to play until the process is complete. You will receive emails to confirm that the process has started and give updates on the progress of your request.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EWill I be able to use the process to copy a Commander from one console to another, or from PC to console?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nNo. The system is only allows console players to copy their save to PC, so that they can enjoy Odyssey content.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EI already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nNo! If you would like to use an account that you already own, clearing your existing PC save will allow your console Commander to then be copied to this account.  If you have an account with a Commander that you would like to keep, you can use a free Horizons account that we will provide for the console profile to move to. To use this free account, you will need to register for a new Frontier account using an email that differs from your existing account.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nTo delete an existing PC Commander profile, open the main menu, select 'Options' and then select 'Clear Save'. You will be asked to confirm the action before your save is deleted.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EWill my console Commander's progress merge with my existing Commander on PC?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nNo. Please see the question \"I already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\" above. You will need to clear your PC save to allow the console save to copy across.  However, any in-game customisation purchases that you have on both platforms (such as Paint Jobs; Bobbleheads, and Ship Kits) will be available to your PC profile.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EWhat will happen to Livery\u002FCustomisation items unlocked or purchased on my existing PC account? Will I be able to access these post-transfer?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nAll items unlocked or purchased on the PC and Console accounts will merge, and all will be available to the newly copied CMDR on PC. \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EHow do I get my free copy of Elite Dangerous: Horizons?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nDuring the copying process, you will be asked to log into an existing PC account or create a new one.  If you opt to create a new account, a Horizons Licence will automatically be applied to the new account.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EWhich PC platform will my copy of Horizons be available on?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nYour Horizons account will be accessible from Frontier's standalone launcher. If you would prefer to play on Steam, you can&nbsp;\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcustomersupport.frontier.co.uk\u002Fhc\u002Fen-us\u002Farticles\u002F360011813740-Can-I-get-a-Steam-key-\"\u003Evisit this page\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, to see how you can activate Elite Dangerous on Steam after receiving your free Horizons account.  If you would prefer to play on the Epic store, you will need to purchase the game there first and use that account for the transfer process.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EIf I have previously purchased Elite Dangerous: Odyssey on PC, will I need to do so again to play it with my console save?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nPlease see the above question \"I already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\". If you are using the account on which you purchased Odyssey and have cleared the existing Commander profile, your copied console CMDR will be usable in Odyssey.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nIf you are using the free copy of Horizons or have copied your console Commander to an account that does not already have access to Odyssey, you will need to Purchase Odyssey to access its content.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EI have an old PC account with a Lifetime Expansion Pass. Can I copy my Console CMDR to this account?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nYes!  However, you would need to clear your save on this account.  Please see the \"I already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\" question, above for more information.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EI previously had a CMDR wealth transfer from PC to console and was told it was a ‘one time only’ thing. Can I now transfer back to PC?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nYes, you can.  Now that Odyssey will not be coming to console, we feel it only fair that you are able to return to PC with the progress you have made on console.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EI am playing Elite Dangerous on Xbox Gamepass. Will I be able to copy my Commander to PC and play there?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nThe process will recognise and copy across valid game licences. If you have not purchased Elite Dangerous on Xbox, you will be able to Copy your save to a new PC account, but will not have a licence to copy across; which means that you will need to purchase the game on PC to be able to launch Elite and access the copied profile.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nIf you are copying your Game Pass profile to an existing PC account that has a licence for Horizons\u002FOdyssey; those licences are retained and you will be able to continue playing with the console profile on PC.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EI already have a PC Commander and would like to keep their name after I transfer my console Commander to this account. How can I do this?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nOnce you clear your existing PC save (see the question \"I already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\" above), that name will become available on PC again. You will be given the option to select a new name as part of the process, so can then select the original name for your copied console profile.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EThe Commander on the existing account that I will be using has the same name as my console Commander. Will this be a problem, as I'd like to keep that name?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nOnce you clear your existing PC save (see the question \"I already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\" above), there will be no duplicate name to cause this potential conflict, so you will be able to continue with the same name without issue. The name will remain reserved by the account that originally owned it, so another CMDR will not be able to claim it whilst the transfer goes through.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EWill my Community Goal progress copy to PC with my Commander?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nNo, it will not.  If there is a live Community Goal at the time copying system goes live, we would advise that you complete this and claim your rewards before performing the move to PC.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EWill I be able to own a Fleet Carrier on both accounts after the transfer is complete?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nYes. There will be no restrictions on this.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cem\u003EThe following questions relate to players that have used the previous system of transferring wealth and want to know more.\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EI purchased Odyssey on PC because I did not want to wait for it to come to console and don't want to lose my progress. Can I still have a wealth transfer and just copy over previously purchased Livery and Customisations from my console account?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nYes! Please be aware that this will result in the deletion of your console profile as it always has.  This will be explained further on the ticket form.  You can\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcustomersupport.frontier.co.uk\u002Fhc\u002Fen-us\u002Frequests\u002Fnew?ticket_form_id=360000784900\"\u003E&nbsp;Submit a Request for this here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cstrong\u003EI transferred from console to PC some time ago. My commander was deleted and I did not get to move my customisation items to PC. Can my old Commander be restored and can I copy them and their customisations to PC?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nCommander profiles from that time will no longer be available, so we are unable to restore the save data for them. However, we can help with copying your console accounts' Commander and ship customisation items to PC.  You can&nbsp;\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcustomersupport.frontier.co.uk\u002Fhc\u002Fen-us\u002Frequests\u002Fnew?ticket_form_id=360000784900\"\u003ESubmit a Request for this here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\nWe hope that all of the above is helpful! If you have any further questions, please share them in the forums via the link below and we'll look to answer them and update the post if and when appropriate!\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\no7\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n",format:F,processed:"\u003Cp\u003EGreetings Commanders,\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nMany of you will be aware that we announced an upcoming process which will allow players to copy progress from their console Commander profiles to PC. You will remain pledged to the same power, at the same level with the same access to Powerplay rewards\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\t\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\t\u003Cli\u003ENPC Crew names, appearance, and progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\t\u003Cli\u003EIn-game customisations, such as Paint Jobs; Bobbleheads; Ship Kits and all other items purchasable with ARX\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\t\u003Cli\u003EAny applied Livery\u002Fcustomisations will remain applied, so your PC CMDR and their ships will appear exactly as they were on Console before the copy\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhich elements of my console profile will NOT be copied to PC?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EYour Commander name if it is already in use by another PC player. It may take longer during times of high demand if your request is part of a queue. You will receive emails to confirm that the process has started and give updates on the progress of your request.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWill I be able to use the process to copy a Commander from one console to another, or from PC to console?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nNo. The system is only allows console players to copy their save to PC, so that they can enjoy Odyssey content.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EI already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nNo! If you would like to use an account that you already own, clearing your existing PC save will allow your console Commander to then be copied to this account.  If you have an account with a Commander that you would like to keep, you can use a free Horizons account that we will provide for the console profile to move to. To use this free account, you will need to register for a new Frontier account using an email that differs from your existing account.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nTo delete an existing PC Commander profile, open the main menu, select 'Options' and then select 'Clear Save'. You will be asked to confirm the action before your save is deleted.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWill my console Commander's progress merge with my existing Commander on PC?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nNo. Please see the question \"I already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\" above. You will need to clear your PC save to allow the console save to copy across.  However, any in-game customisation purchases that you have on both platforms (such as Paint Jobs; Bobbleheads, and Ship Kits) will be available to your PC profile.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhat will happen to Livery\u002FCustomisation items unlocked or purchased on my existing PC account? Will I be able to access these post-transfer?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nAll items unlocked or purchased on the PC and Console accounts will merge, and all will be available to the newly copied CMDR on PC. \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EHow do I get my free copy of Elite Dangerous: Horizons?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nDuring the copying process, you will be asked to log into an existing PC account or create a new one.  If you opt to create a new account, a Horizons Licence will automatically be applied to the new account.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhich PC platform will my copy of Horizons be available on?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nYour Horizons account will be accessible from Frontier's standalone launcher. If you would prefer to play on Steam, you can \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcustomersupport.frontier.co.uk\u002Fhc\u002Fen-us\u002Farticles\u002F360011813740-Can-I-get-a-Steam-key-\"\u003Evisit this page\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, to see how you can activate Elite Dangerous on Steam after receiving your free Horizons account.  If you would prefer to play on the Epic store, you will need to purchase the game there first and use that account for the transfer process.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EIf I have previously purchased Elite Dangerous: Odyssey on PC, will I need to do so again to play it with my console save?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nPlease see the above question \"I already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\" above), that name will become available on PC again. You will be given the option to select a new name as part of the process, so can then select the original name for your copied console profile.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe Commander on the existing account that I will be using has the same name as my console Commander. Will this be a problem, as I'd like to keep that name?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nOnce you clear your existing PC save (see the question \"I already have a PC account. Do I need a new one?\" above), there will be no duplicate name to cause this potential conflict, so you will be able to continue with the same name without issue. The name will remain reserved by the account that originally owned it, so another CMDR will not be able to claim it whilst the transfer goes through.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWill my Community Goal progress copy to PC with my Commander?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nNo, it will not.  If there is a live Community Goal at the time copying system goes live, we would advise that you complete this and claim your rewards before performing the move to PC.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWill I be able to own a Fleet Carrier on both accounts after the transfer is complete?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nYes. There will be no restrictions on this.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n \u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cem\u003EThe following questions relate to players that have used the previous system of transferring wealth and want to know more.\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EI purchased Odyssey on PC because I did not want to wait for it to come to console and don't want to lose my progress. Can I still have a wealth transfer and just copy over previously purchased Livery and Customisations from my console account?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nYes! Please be aware that this will result in the deletion of your console profile as it always has.  This will be explained further on the ticket form.  You can\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcustomersupport.frontier.co.uk\u002Fhc\u002Fen-us\u002Frequests\u002Fnew?ticket_form_id=360000784900\"\u003E Submit a Request for this here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EI transferred from console to PC some time ago. My commander was deleted and I did not get to move my customisation items to PC. Can my old Commander be restored and can I copy them and their customisations to PC?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nCommander profiles from that time will no longer be available, so we are unable to restore the save data for them. However, we can help with copying your console accounts' Commander and ship customisation items to PC.  You can \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcustomersupport.frontier.co.uk\u002Fhc\u002Fen-us\u002Frequests\u002Fnew?ticket_form_id=360000784900\"\u003ESubmit a Request for this here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nWe hope that all of the above is helpful! If you have any further questions, please share them in the forums via the link below and we'll look to answer them and update the post if and when appropriate!\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\no7\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n",summary:g},"field-category":ab,"field-feature-in-game":e,"field-featured-bool":c,"field-hide-from-website-listings":e,"field-link":{uri:"https:\u002F\u002Fforums.frontier.co.uk\u002Fthreads\u002Fconsole-profile-transfers-faq-and-expected-date.603979\u002F",title:"Join The Discussion",options:[]},"field-link-type":ai,"field-slug":"console-profile-transfers-faq-and-expected-date",id:"8a65d87d-003a-4bc5-95ec-0b41ed954b9e","field-game":[a,a],"field-site":[{langcode:b,name:i,description:a,weight:f,changed:k,"field-influencer-news":c,"field-slug":j,id:l}],"field-image-entity":{langcode:b,name:"DixonDock.jpg",created:cl,changed:cl,id:"10c885df-fb33-4c5c-8d49-d5d3fc47b047","field-game":[],thumbnail:{langcode:b,filename:jy,uri:{value:jz,url:jA},filemime:d,filesize:jB,created:cl,changed:jC,id:jD},"field-media-image":{langcode:b,filename:jy,uri:{value:jz,url:jA},filemime:d,filesize:jB,created:cl,changed:jC,id:jD}},links:H},{langcode:b,title:"Console Profile Transfers and 2022 Updates",created:"2022-05-11T13:18:27+00:00",changed:"2022-05-13T15:13:25+00:00","publish-on":a,"unpublish-on":a,"published-at":"2022-05-13T13:00:00+00:00",body:{value:"\u003Cp\u003EGreetings Commanders,\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe’d like to thank you all for your patience whilst we’ve been working on our communications and development plans for the remainder of the year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EFollowing the launch of Odyssey, our primary focus has been on performance, optimisation and bug fixing, along with adding more features. This focus has had a knock-on effect with regards to our plans for this year and beyond and delayed our communications.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe understand the concern and frustration this has caused and hope this post goes some way to alleviate those feelings. Below we discuss profile transfers for console players and give an overview of the updates coming before the end of 2022.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EConsole Profile Transfers\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe can now confirm that players will be able to copy their profiles from console to PC in light of Odyssey’s cancellation on Xbox and PlayStation. This process will be time limited and optional. We will provide a date for this process once it is confirmed.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe original profile will remain playable on console and the new PC profile will be a copy. Only one profile may be copied over per copy of the game. Please also be aware that this will be a one-time only process.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch4\u003EElements that will be copied\u003C\u002Fh4\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EShips, Holo-Me, weapons, SRVs and SLFs\r\n\t\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EIncluding Cobra Mk IV if owned\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\t\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ECore progression (this includes…)\r\n\t\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EInventory\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EReputation\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003ENavy Ranks\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EPermits\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003ECodex Discoveries\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EEngineering progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\t\u003Cli\u003EGuardian Tech Broker progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\t\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ENPC Crew progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ECosmetics*\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E*Cosmetic items applied through the Livery (ships and Fleet Carriers) and Holo-Me will remain applied.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch4\u003EElements that won’t be copied\u003C\u002Fh4\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ECommander name*\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EARX Balance**\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ESquadron membership\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EFriends lists, Block lists and Private Groups\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ECurrent mission progress\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ENPC Crew names and appearances\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E*The process will require a new name to be chosen if the original name is not available on PC.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E**ARX balances cannot be transferred. We recommend that anyone who submits their account for the transfer process purchases any desired cosmetics beforehand. Any unspent ARX post-transfer will remain available on the original console profile.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EFleet Carriers and their contents\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EFleet Carrier ownership cannot be transferred from one Commander to another. To players that wish to own a Fleet Carrier post-transfer we would advise the following:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Col\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EDecommission your Fleet Carrier ahead of the transfer\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EWait for the decommissioning to complete (two weeks).\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ECheck that credits from the decommissioning have been returned.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EComplete the profile transfer process\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ERe-purchase a Fleet Carrier on PC\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EPrecise dates for the opening and close of this process will be announced closer to the time.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch3\u003ERoadmap\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere we present our top-level roadmap for the remainder of 2022. Our three focuses before the year ends are launching the next phase of the narrative, stability and optimisation. We’ll release three more updates to support these.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWithin the narrative, human space balances on the precipice as tension mounts within the bubble. The Azimuth Saga will conclude in a grand finale event, the consequences of which will mark the beginning of the next stage of the Elite story in Update 14.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EMeanwhile, updates 12 and 13 will largely focus on quality-of-life changes, stability and optimisation. Work has also begun on a major feature overhaul for 2023 that we’ll discuss later in the year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EPlease note that the details and timings of each release are subject to change and that any adjustments will be shared ahead of time. Beyond this we are also discussing additional game content, and we’ll reveal it once confirmed.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch4\u003EMay 2022\u003C\u002Fh4\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EUpdate 12\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EA new mission variant\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EStability\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EOptimisation\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch4\u003EAugust 2022\u003C\u002Fh4\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EUpdate 13\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ENarrative content\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EStability\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EOptimisation\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch4\u003ENovember 2022\u003C\u002Fh4\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EUpdate 14\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003ENext major narrative phase\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EStability\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch4\u003EEarly 2023\u003C\u002Fh4\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\t\u003Cli\u003EKey feature overhaul\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EDevelopment Updates and Streams\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EFollowing the launch of Odyssey in 2021, we started publishing monthly development posts to share our progress on subsequent updates. In light of the remaining updates for 2022 being confirmed above, these will not continue. However, we will still provide detailed patch notes, information, and other relevant details around updates and hotfixes as they are released between each development post.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003ERegular streams from the Community team have returned. Going forwards, these will be fortnightly on Thursdays at 16:00-18:00 GMT. This additional time between streams will allow us to put on longer shows and take full advantage of the in-office studio. Frameshift Live has only just started and we have many exciting ideas to explore in the future! If you have not been watching, these streams now feature new and exclusive Twitch Drops that can be earned simply by watching.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe will also be launching our Partnership Programme later this year, offering content creators their own exclusive Twitch drops their communities can earn by watching them. More on this in the coming months!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe hope this post clarifies our continued support and plans for Elite. As always, we thank you for your feedback and support.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003EO7\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EImage credit: \u003Cspan\u003ECMDR Aymerix\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n",format:n,processed:"\u003Cp\u003EGreetings Commanders,\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EWe’d like to thank you all for your patience whilst we’ve been working on our communications and development plans for the remainder of the year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\n\u003Cp\u003EFollowing the launch of Odyssey, our primary focus has been on performance, optimisation and bug fixing, along with adding more features.
